reviews.text: Jupiter Hotel was a perfect home base for my 3-day stay in Amsterdam. Located on a quiet street, it was within easy walking distance of Leidseplein (tram stop loaded with cafes, bars and restaurants), Vondelpark, and the museum square. My single room was quite small, but that's to be expected in a 2-star hotel in Europe. The bathroom was a good size with a great shower. As for the breakfast, there were boiled eggs, meats, cheeses, fruit, mini-croissants, cereal, and a few types of bread (including multi-grain) - hardly a disappointment in my opinion. I found the owners to be helpful and appreciated the internet access in the lobby. I would definitely consider Hotel Jupiter for a future trip to Amsterdam - had a wonderful time.
reviews.title: Perfect for my stay

reviews.text: -Great location near Leidseplein. Tram-, Busstation arround the corner.
reviews.title: False Accusation at Hotel Jupiter
they even found us a place to park our SUV
I would not recommend this hotel to anyone

reviews.text: Definitely clean, bright, cheery. Walking into this place is cool -- it feels like you're going into someone's house. Plus, if you have a room that overlooks the backyard, you'll see that the view is of many backyards -- the neighbors'. I was excited about this because you can see people gardening, out on the deck, having dinner, like what regular Dutch people do. It was very serene and peaceful up there. I often sat at the window at sunset and wrote in my journal.
reviews.title: Clean and Quiet

reviews.text: Being an American, the strange Dutch window was impossible to open! It slanted out at the top, making only a small crack for air to flow in through, but finally I learned how to shut it and push it open fully so that it swung out.
reviews.title: Great little Hotel
Cozy nice
reviews.text: The bathroom was spacious and sparkling clean, and the elevator gave us no trouble.

reviews.title: jupiter-just the ticket!!
reviews.text: The owner was a little distant and aloof.

reviews.title: great place to explore the city!
reviews.text: This hotel is close to Leidseplein. It's about a 4 minute walk.

reviews.title: Good, clean & affordable place to stay , good value for money!
reviews.text: I travel a lot, and like affordable, clean hotels that offer me what I need, instead of making me pay for what I do not use. This hotel offers bed and breakfast, and is in the center of all attractions in Amsterdam. Yes, it is NOT in the HISTORICAL center of Amsterdam, but the major outgoing areas, the musea and concert hall, and all that I like a city for, are within walking distance. Despite of what I just read in another review, This hotel DOES have an elevator. I had a clean room, nice bed and a very complete European breakfast (buffet). Cerials, milk, oj, coffe, tea, 3 or 4 kinds of meat, cheese, sweet stuff, different kinds of bread, eggs etc.. Yep, NOT an American breakfast , but we're in this IS Europe. It is ran and owned by a family, and I really enjoyed their hospiltality and my stay. The stairs are steep, but that is normal in all original buildings in Amsterdam. And the rooms are not too big, but not too small eather. Good value for money. I do definetely recommend this. Ulli

reviews.title: Very pleasant stay -- far better than a hostel and about the same price!
reviews.text: I just returned home from a five-night stay at the Jupiter, staying in a triple room with two other friends, and we had a wonderful time... I think that visitors have to go in knowing that this is a two-star hotel (i.e. no room service, etc. essentially a clean, comfortable place to stay) to be able to enjoy the amenities the hotel has to offer. The hotel is fairly small, and taken care of by an accordingly small though very kind and accomodating staff. Not sure how many floors there are in the place, maybe three or four including the ground floor, but there are about three rooms per floor. Our triple room was about 15-17 m2 containing two single beds and a queen, so it comfortably accomodated three people, and could do four if the queen is shared. The room had the essential private bathroom, television (which in Amsterdam means all kinds of international stations, though it might have been cable, I'm not sure...) closet, mirror, table and chairs, and a safe. Not the Ritz by far, but very comfortable, cozy, and clean. The bathroom is according fairly standard and small, equipped with complimentary soap and towels and things, and the shower (at least in our room) is very much integrated into the bathroom meaning that there is no curtain.

reviews.title: Ok at the Jupiter
reviews.text: Just have to make sure you don't point the removable showerhead everywhere in order to keep the rest of the bathroom dry. The stairs in the place are indeed very steep, though by what I could tell from the rest of Amsterdam, it's not all that rare and is a space-saving mechanism. So I would probably not advise this particular hotel to anyone who might have physical difficulties or disabilities, or who otherwise might have problems traversing steep stairs. A sit-down buffet breakfast is included in the room price, and again it's not a five-star meal, but it's complete and free! (well, included...) Coffee, teas, juices, cereals, bread and cold cuts, etc. Quite nice...
